The Coding Life

Learning to Code: Week 2 Update

Hit my first wall this week. Started on Chris Pine’s ‘Learn to Program. The first half of the book went pretty quickly.  It was challenging but completely doable. Chapters 8 & 9 were difficult enough that I had to look far to often at the answers in the back. By chapter 10, I was in over my head. There was a second sorting exercise that I should have been able to attack myself, and I didn’t even know where to start.

The good news is, I have Plan B. I have started Zed Shaw’s ‘Learn Ruby the Hard Way.” I completed his command line tutorial, and now I’m starting on Ruby. It’s been a little repetitive of the concepts I covered in ‘Learn to Program,’ but repetition is good. I have a feeling there are a million ways to teach any language, and I’m now getting my second way. Once I finish this, I’ll go back to Pine’s book. Hopefully, I’ll be ready for it.

(In between these two resources, I did complete the free tutorial on Code School, but it wasn’t for me. Too cute, and just didn’t hit my buttons as a learner. No harm, no foul. It’s good to know what doesn’t work for me as well as what does.

May 31, 2014

M
